jobsJson.descriptionPlain:
GoPay started as an e-money wallet for Gojek, Indonesia's first and leading ride-sharing application for transport, food delivery, and other on-demand services. However, the growth of GoPay does not stop here. We are hungry for more. With the addition of three companies (Kartuku, Midtrans, Mapan) laying the foundation for Gojek's financial services ecosystem, Gopay will continue to become the e-money wallet for all our on-demand services, fulfilling its broader mission of leapfrogging Indonesia to the digital era, bringing financial inclusion to all 260 million Indonesians. 

GoPay processes more than $2B USD in transactions annually and is expanding its business to Singapore, Thailand, Vietnam and beyond. We are looking for an exceptional manager to identify potential fraud and risks related to credit and debit card acceptance. Join us in a race to identify patterns and trends to stay ahead of the dynamic fraud landscape.

jobsJson.additionalPlain:
Gojek is a technology startup based in Jakarta, Indonesia. Specialising in ride-hailing and logistics, we are also the only company in Southeast Asia to be part of Fortune's 50 Companies That Changed the World (2017).

Gojek is a Super App: one app with over 20 services including food delivery, commuting, digital payments, shopping, hyper-local delivery, massages, and many more.

Gojek is Indonesia’s first and fastest growing unicorn building an on-demand empire. Our total of 2,000,000 driver-partners collectively travel 16.5 million KM daily – making us Indonesia’s de-facto transportation choice.

Gojek is a verb! Gojek is a way of life!

lists.content:
• Support the business operations team and fraud team in outage monitoring and impact analysis
  • Undertake fraud analysis and support the recovery of financial losses arising from fraud
  • Reconciliation of wallet movements to bank statements
  • Work with stakeholders (operations, finance) to set up and implement end-to-end process flows to cover issues arising from potential fraud
  • Categorise and identify issues, improvements to processes, mitigation actions
  • Liaison between external partners and internal stakeholders to identify system issues and implement mitigating actions
  • Coherently present information relating to payment/fraud issues and mitigating factors to update and garner support from senior stakeholders
  • Work with EPD (Engineering, Product, Data) to project manage initiatives targeted at reducing payment/fraud issues
  • Support roll-out and testing of new payment features and functionalities (eg. PayLah)

• Degree in any field
  • At least 4 years of operations experience
  • Experience in wallet/payments/ financial institutions would be considered favourably
  • Strong communication and organisation skills
  • Experience managing senior stakeholders and collaborating cross-functionally
  • Great team player with strong, demonstrated leadership capabilities
  • Enjoys and excels in simplifying complex issues - constantly working toward clarity and delivery
  • Excel/data management skills with a knack for finding the value in the data and using it to inform decisions; knowledge of processing large datasets with SQL (or equivalent tools) an advantage
